title: Goldman Sachs created an A.I.-powered social media startup for corporate use
description: Under CEO David Solomon, Goldman has sought to speed up its digital makeover by hiring Google and Amazon executives and asking employees to pitch startup ideas.

title: U.S. can avoid default in July if Treasury can make it through June cash crunch, Congressional Budget Office says
description: Tax revenues and emergency measures after June 15 will let Treasury "continue financing operations through at least the end of July," said the CBO.

title: Fed Governor Philip Jefferson named as new vice chair to succeed Lael Brainard
description: Federal Reserve Governor Philip Jefferson will be nominated by President Joe Biden to be vice chairman of the central bank's board

title: NBCUniversal ad chief Linda Yaccarino resigns as sources say she's in talks to be Twitter CEO
description: The announcement comes after Elon Musk said he had hired a new CEO for Twitter.

title: China's biggest chipmaker posts first quarterly revenue fall in 3 years as semiconductor woes persist
description: SMIC has been hit with U.S. sanctions that have cut the company off from key chipmaking tools to manufacture the most advanced semiconductors.

title: Autonomy founder Mike Lynch extradited to the U.S. to face fraud charges
description: Lynch arrived in the U.S. Thursday afternoon and is currently detained in San Francisco until bail conditions are met, his spokesperson told CNBC.

title: 'Still a long way to go': UK finance minister warns inflation remains far too high
description: U.K. Finance Minister Jeremy Hunt issued a warning on his nation's persistently high inflation rate.

title: Bitcoin falls to lowest level since March as thin liquidity, regulatory pressure hits crypto markets
description: Crypto markets face a number of issues including low liquidity, a crackdown on the industry from regulators in the U.S. and macroeconomic headwinds.

title: SoftBank shares drop after its Vision Fund tech investment unit posts a $32 billion record loss
description: SoftBank's Vision Fund segment lost a record 4.3 trillion Japanese yen ($32 billion) for its fiscal year ending Mar. 31.

title: As Turkey heads to the polls, currency traders are bracing for absolute chaos
description: Turkey is holding both its presidential and parliamentary elections on Sunday.

title: UK economy grows by 0.1% in the first quarter but inflation continues to weigh
description: U.K. gross domestic product figures for March showed a 0.1% growth.

title: Netflix's $2.5 billion investment in Korean content appeals to audiences worldwide
description: By expanding its slate of Korean series, films and non-fiction shows, Netflix aims to increase the success that Korean content has found with global audiences.

title: In major milestone, wind power was Britain's largest source of electricity in the first quarter
description: The U.K. is home to a mature offshore wind sector that looks set to expand in the coming years.

title: Can the UK afford to host Ukraine’s Eurovision? It can’t afford not to
description: This year's edition is "a rekindling of a British love affair with Eurovision and of British relations with Europe," one analyst says.

title: Turkey's Erdogan faces toughest test yet in landmark election — with high stakes for the world
description: Erdogan is in the fight for his political life after two decades in power.

title: Russian diamonds could soon be sanctioned — potentially disrupting the global jewelry market
description: The seven most advanced economies in the world, the G-7, are discussing imposing sanctions on Russian diamond exports — a complicated measure that could potentially hike prices for the luxury commodity.

title: Debt in advanced economies is piling on to global challenges, says World Bank president
description: World Bank President David Malpass said global debt levels need to be addressed in an interview with CNBC at the G7 Finance Ministers and Central Bank Governors' meeting in Japan.

title: How to explore Greece's lesser-known islands like a local
description: Many tourists go to the same places in Greece. Now the country is investing money to highlight other places that are just as beautiful, but less crowded.

title: Want to buy a cheap house in rural Japan? This millennial farmer offers his advice
description: "This is specifically for Japan: If you can't speak the language, you can't get along with your neighbors … communication is very difficult," said Lee Xian Jie.
